## R & Friends

#### R Programming

 - [Big Book of R](https://www.bigbookofr.com/) compiled by Oscar Baruffa
 - [R for Data Science](https://r4ds.hadley.nz/) by Hadley Wickham and Garrett Grolemund
 - [Advanced R](https://adv-r.hadley.nz/) by Hadley Wickham
 - [Adavned R Solutions](https://advanced-r-solutions.rbind.io/) by Malte Grosser and Henning Bumann
 - [ggplot2](https://ggplot2-book.org/) by Hadley Wickham
 - [R Packages](https://r-pkgs.org/) by Hadley Wickham and Jenny Bryan
 
#### Git

 - [Pro Git](https://git-scm.com/book/en/v2) by Scott Chacon and Ben Straub
 - [Happy Git and GitHub for the UserR](https://happygitwithr.com/) by Jenny Bryan
 - [Git in Practice](https://www.manning.com/books/git-in-practice) by Mike McQuaid

#### Vim

 - [OpenVim](https://www.openvim.com/) by Henrik Huttunen
 - [Mastering the Vim Language](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=wlR5gYd6um0) recorded presentation by Chris Toomey
 - [Vim as Your Editor](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=X6AR2RMB5tE&list=PLm323Lc7iSW_wuxqmKx_xxNtJC_hJbQ7R) a 6-part playist by ThePrimeagen

## Less Academic 

#### On Life

 - [This is Water](https://web.ics.purdue.edu/~drkelly/DFWKenyonAddress2005.pdf) by David Foster Wallace
 - [A Mathematician's Lament](http://worrydream.com/refs/Lockhart-MathematiciansLament.pdf) by Paul Lockhart
 - [Teaching Smart People How to Learn](https://hbr.org/1991/05/teaching-smart-people-how-to-learn) by Chris Argyris

#### On Writing

 - [How to Send and Reply to email](https://matt.might.net/articles/how-to-email/) by Matt Might
 - [Publication, Publication](https://gking.harvard.edu/sites/scholar.harvard.edu/files/gking/files/paperspub.pdf) by Gary King

#### On Getting a PhD (in Econ or Marketing)

 - Ken Wilbur: [Reasons to Get (or Not) a PhD](https://kennethcwilbur.github.io/website//#:~:text=Reasons%20to%20get%20or%20not%20get%20a%20Ph.D.) and [Choosing a field, Subfield, and PhD Program](https://kennethcwilbur.github.io/website//#:~:text=Choosing%20a%20field%2C%20subfield%20and%20Ph.D.%20program)
 - Susan Athey: [Professional Advice](https://gsb-faculty.stanford.edu/susan-athey/professional-advice/)
 - Jesse Shapiro: [Notes on Applying for a PhD in Economics](https://scholar.harvard.edu/files/shapiro/files/phdnotes.pdf)
